p: The energy storage market can be divided into two sectors: the stationary and the mobile [ 1]. The stationary sector is related with the cost per unit energy, while the mobile sector is expressed as cost per unit energy density. Specifically, energy industry applications including electric vehicles, and large-scale energy storage systems (EESs) require EESs with safety, high reliability, advanced energy density, and low cost [ 2]. This means that inexpensive materials as well as low energy- and time-consuming processes will be needed to meet the performance targets [ 3, 4].
